intro: Hedyotis tenelliflora var. papuana, commonly known as the Papuan smallleaf geranium, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Papua. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of tiny, white to pinkish flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
